intro: Alyxia cylindrocarpa, commonly known as the round-fruit alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pink or red, with five lobes. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
